abstract: Niger gives International Criminal Court in Netherlands first suspect associated with 2012 destruction of historic Timbuktu buildings; Ahmad al-Mahdi al-Faqi, alleged member of Al Qaeda linked group called Ansar Dine, is charged with wrecking ancient structures, including tombs and mosque.
lead_paragraph: The Islamist extremist is the first person in the International Criminal Court’s custody who has been charged with the war crime of deliberately destroying religious or historical monuments.

headline.main: Suspect Arrested in Destruction of Monuments in Mali
headline.print_headline: Suspect Arrested in Destruction of Monuments in Mali

snippet: The Islamist extremist is the first person in the International Criminal Court’s custody who has been charged with the war crime of deliberately destroying religious or historical monuments.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
